solution_line_template: She bought {num_dresses} dresses at ${cost_per_dress} each for a total of {num_dresses}*${cost_per_dress} = $<<{num_dresses}*{cost_per_dress}={cost_dresses}>>{cost_dresses}
She bought {num_pants} pairs of pants at ${cost_per_pant} each for a total of {num_pants}*${cost_per_pant} = $<<{num_pants}*{cost_per_pant}={cost_pants}>>{cost_pants}
She bought {num_jackets} jackets at ${cost_per_jacket} each for a total of {num_jackets}*${cost_per_jacket} = $<<{num_jackets}*{cost_per_jacket}={cost_jackets}>>{cost_jackets}

She spent an additional ${transportation_cost} on transportation for a sum total of ${transportation_cost}+${cost_dresses}+${cost_pants}+${cost_jackets} = $<<{transportation_cost}+{cost_dresses}+{cost_pants}+{cost_jackets}={total_spent}>>{total_spent}
She initially had ${initial_money} so she now has ${initial_money}-${total_spent} = $<<{initial_money}-{total_spent}={money_remaining}>>{money_remaining}
